system_template.name: questions_system_template_default
system_template.template: Only provide a short, concise, brief and accurate response. Provide your response in a short summary paragraph. Only provide the response.

data.system_prompt: Only provide a short, concise, brief and accurate response. Provide your response in a short summary paragraph. Only provide the response.
data.response: Dogs are domesticated mammals that are considered one of the most beloved pets. There are hundreds of dog breeds that come in many different sizes, colors, and personalities. Dogs are known for their loyalty, playfulness, and ability to be trained. They have an excellent sense of smell and hearing and are often used for tasks like hunting, police work, and guiding the blind. Dogs are omnivores and require a balanced diet of protein, carbohydrates, and fats. They communicate through barking, whining, and body language. Providing dogs with daily walks, play, training, and affection is important for their health and happiness.

data.system_prompt: Only provide a short, concise, brief and accurate response. Provide your response in a short summary paragraph. Only provide the response.
data.response: - There are over 200 breeds of domestic pig worldwide. Some common breeds are Yorkshire, Landrace, Duroc, Hampshire, and Potbelly. - Pigs are omnivores and will eat a wide variety of foods including grains, fruits, vegetables, nuts, roots, eggs, milk, meat etc. - They have an excellent sense of smell and use their snout to find food and sense their surroundings. Their snout has many sensory receptors. - Adult pigs can weigh between 100-900 lbs depending on the breed. - Pigs are unable to sweat and regulate their body temperature by wallowing in mud to cool down. - Pigs are social, intelligent animals and establish dominance hierarchies when in groups. - The gestation period of a pig is 3 months, 3 weeks, and 3 days. On average a sow will give birth to 10-12 piglets. - Pigs can live 8-18 years depending on breed.

data.system_prompt: Only provide a short, concise, brief and accurate response. Provide your response in a short summary paragraph. Only provide the response.
data.response: Dogs are often cared for by their owners or families. Responsibilities of caring for a dog include providing food, water, shelter, exercise, affection, and veterinary care. Professional pet care services like dog walkers, pet sitters, kennels, and doggy daycares also help care for dogs when owners are away. Overall, dogs depend on humans to provide for their wellbeing and care.

data.system_prompt: Only provide a short, concise, brief and accurate response. Provide your response in a short summary paragraph. Only provide the response.
data.response: A pig farmer or swineherd takes care of pigs. Pigs require daily care including feeding, watering, and cleaning their pens. Pig farmers monitor the health and growth of pigs and make sure they receive proper nutrition. They also assist with breeding and farrowing of piglets. Overall, pig farmers are responsible for the day-to-day care and management of pigs on a farm or pig production facility.

data.system_prompt: Only provide a short, concise, brief and accurate response. Provide your response in a short summary paragraph. Only provide the response.
data.response: - Habitats provide animals with food, water, shelter, and space to raise young. Animals are adapted to live in certain habitats. - Some animals live underground in burrows, while others live in trees, caves, or build nests. Aquatic animals live in water habitats. - Many animals migrate seasonally between different habitats. - Animals live on every continent and in every major environment on Earth. Habitats can be terrestrial or aquatic. - Human activities like deforestation, urbanization, and agriculture have impacted and reduced natural habitats for many animal species.

data.system_prompt: Only provide a short, concise, brief and accurate response. Provide your response in a short summary paragraph. Only provide the response.
data.response: A bat is a mammal that belongs to the order Chiroptera. Bats are the only mammals capable of true flight. They use echolocation to locate prey and navigate. Bats are found all over the world and are important for controlling insect populations as well as pollinating some plants. They are nocturnal and roost upside down in caves, trees, and buildings. There are over 1,300 species of bats.

data.query: Can you tell me about cows?
data.user_prompt: Can you tell me about cows?
data.system_prompt: Only provide a short, concise, brief and accurate response. Provide your response in a short summary paragraph. Only provide the response.
data.response: Cows are large domesticated bovine animals. There are many different breeds of cows, but they are all characterized by being ruminants with four stomach compartments that allow them to digest tough grasses and vegetation. Cows are raised for their milk, meat, leather, and dung. They typically live in herds and spend much of their day grazing on pastures or eating hay. Cows are important farm animals around the world and provide food and other products that are valuable to humans.

data.system_prompt: Only provide a short, concise, brief and accurate response. Provide your response in a short summary paragraph. Only provide the response.
data.response: Cats are often independent, aloof, and cautious around new people or situations. They can be affectionate and playful, especially with familiar people, but also value having their own space. Cats are natural hunters and often exhibit stalking behaviors and playfulness. They groom themselves extensively. Cats communicate through vocalizations like meowing, purring, and hissing as well as with body language. They have daily routines and feel most comfortable with consistency and predictability in their environment and interactions.

data.query: What kind of food do humans eat?
data.user_prompt: What kind of food do humans eat?
data.system_prompt: Only provide a short, concise, brief and accurate response. Provide your response in a short summary paragraph. Only provide the response.
data.response: Humans are omnivores and eat a wide variety of foods including fruits, vegetables, grains, proteins, and dairy. Common foods eaten by humans include rice, wheat, potatoes, meat, poultry, fish, eggs, milk, fruits like apples and oranges, and vegetables like lettuce, tomatoes, and carrots. The diversity of the human diet allows intake of essential nutrients and energy.

data.system_prompt: Only provide a short, concise, brief and accurate response. Provide your response in a short summary paragraph. Only provide the response.
data.response: Tuna are large, fast swimming fish that belong to the family Scombridae. They are found in temperate and tropical oceans around the world. Tuna are predator fish that hunt smaller fish and other marine animals. There are many species of tuna including bluefin, yellowfin, albacore, and skipjack. Tuna are economically important as a commercial food fish. However, some tuna populations such as bluefin tuna have declined due to overfishing. Tuna are caught by commercial fishing fleets using various techniques like longlines and purse seines. They are canned and sold widely for human consumption.

data.system_prompt: Only provide a short, concise, brief and accurate response. Provide your response in a short summary paragraph. Only provide the response.
data.response: Wales is a country in western Great Britain that is part of the United Kingdom. It has a long coastline along the Irish Sea and Bristol Channel. The landscape is mountainous with many peaks and valleys. Wales has its own Celtic language and culture. Major cities include the capital Cardiff and Swansea. Wales is known for its castles, rugged coastline, national parks like Snowdonia, and mining history. The national symbol is the red dragon.

data.query: Can you tell me more about fish?
data.user_prompt: Can you tell me more about fish?
data.system_prompt: Only provide a short, concise, brief and accurate response. Provide your response in a short summary paragraph. Only provide the response.
data.response: Fish are aquatic vertebrate animals that live in water and breathe through gills. They are cold-blooded, have fins and scales, and lay eggs. There are over 30,000 known species of fish that inhabit oceans, lakes, rivers and other water bodies. Fish come in a huge variety of shapes, sizes, colors and adaptations. They are an important part of aquatic ecosystems and are caught both commercially and recreationally for food. Many species of fish are popular aquarium pets. Overall, fish display incredible diversity and play vital ecological roles in the waters they inhabit.

data.system_prompt: Only provide a short, concise, brief and accurate response. Provide your response in a short summary paragraph. Only provide the response.
data.response: A zoo is a facility where animals are confined within enclosures for public display. Zoos exhibit wild animals for education and conservation purposes. Key aspects of a zoo include animal habitats and enclosures, veterinary care for the animals, education programs for visitors, breeding programs, and research activities. The goal of most modern zoos is to promote animal conservation while providing an opportunity for the public to observe wildlife.

data.system_prompt: Only provide a short, concise, brief and accurate response. Provide your response in a short summary paragraph. Only provide the response.
data.response: Ivory is a valuable material that comes from the tusks and teeth of animals like elephants, walruses, hippopotamuses, and narwhals. Due to restrictions on the ivory trade and declining populations of these animals, ivory has become increasingly rare and expensive over time. Today, ivory is viewed as a luxury material used in things like jewelry, ornaments, art, and piano keys. Both the difficulty of obtaining ivory and the demand for it contribute to its high prices.

data.system_prompt: Only provide a short, concise, brief and accurate response. Provide your response in a short summary paragraph. Only provide the response.
data.response: Ivory is a hard, smooth material derived from the tusks and teeth of animals, most notably elephants. For centuries it was used to make items like jewelry, piano keys, and ornamental objects. Ivory was highly prized and traded extensively, which led to the decimation of elephant populations. The ivory trade is now banned internationally to protect endangered elephants. Synthetic ivories have been developed as an alternative.

data.query: What kind of food do lions eat?
data.user_prompt: What kind of food do lions eat?
data.system_prompt: Only provide a short, concise, brief and accurate response. Provide your response in a short summary paragraph. Only provide the response.
data.response: Lions are carnivores and eat primarily meat. Their prey includes antelopes, zebras, wildebeests, buffaloes, and other large animals. Lions hunt and kill these animals using their claws and powerful jaws. They usually eat the flesh and organs of their prey, and sometimes bones as well. As carnivores, meat makes up the vast majority of a lion's diet.

data.query: What kinds of food do humans eat?
data.user_prompt: What kinds of food do humans eat?
data.system_prompt: Only provide a short, concise, brief and accurate response. Provide your response in a short summary paragraph. Only provide the response.
data.response: Humans eat a wide variety of foods. Some common categories of foods eaten by humans include fruits, vegetables, grains, proteins (meat, dairy, eggs, legumes), and fats/oils. The specific foods consumed depend on factors like geography, culture, preferences, health status, and access. Overall, humans are omnivores and can obtain nutrients from both plant and animal sources.

data.query: Are fish a good source of food?
data.user_prompt: Are fish a good source of food?
data.system_prompt: Only provide a short, concise, brief and accurate response. Provide your response in a short summary paragraph. Only provide the response.
data.response: Fish can be a nutritious part of a balanced diet. Fish provide high-quality protein, omega-3 fatty acids, vitamins, and minerals. However, some fish may contain contaminants like mercury, so moderation and choosing low-mercury fish are recommended. Overall, fish can be a healthy food choice as part of a varied diet.

data.query: Tell me a bit how chickens evolved.
data.user_prompt: Tell me a bit how chickens evolved.
data.system_prompt: Only provide a short, concise, brief and accurate response. Provide your response in a short summary paragraph. Only provide the response.
data.response: The domestic chicken evolved from the red junglefowl, a bird native to Southeast Asia. It is believed that junglefowl were first domesticated around 8,000 years ago in Asia. Through selective breeding over thousands of years, humans shaped the junglefowl into the familiar domestic chickens we know today. Some key evolutionary changes include a reduction in aggressive behavior, increased egg-laying, and adaptations for meat production like increased body size. The dozens of chicken breeds we have now are the result of isolating and selecting for particular traits over generations. In summary, chickens evolved from red junglefowl through artificial selection by humans over several millennia for traits desirable for food production.

data.system_prompt: Only provide a short, concise, brief and accurate response. Provide your response in a short summary paragraph. Only provide the response.
data.response: The chicken-and-egg causality dilemma refers to the question of which came first - chickens or chicken eggs. This dilemma stems from the observation that all chickens hatch from eggs, and all chicken eggs are laid by chickens. - Evolutionary ancestors of chickens laid eggs that then mutated and hatched into chickens. So the egg came first. - Proto-chickens that were almost chickens, but not quite, laid eggs containing the first true chickens. So the egg came first. - The first chicken was genetically distinct from its parents and thus came about through some other evolutionary process, not being hatched from an egg. So the chicken came first. Ultimately there is no definitive scientific answer, since no one can point to the first chicken or egg fossil. The dilemma highlights the complex causal relationships in evolution. But most experts think the egg likely came first, laid by a proto-chicken ancestor.

data.system_prompt: Only provide a short, concise, brief and accurate response. Provide your response in a short summary paragraph. Only provide the response.
data.response: Eggs are oval or round reproductive cells produced by female animals. They contain all the nutrients and genetic material needed for an embryo to develop. The hard outer shell protects the developing embryo and allows gas exchange. The most commonly eaten eggs come from chickens, ducks, quail, and fish. Eggs are an excellent source of protein and nutrients. They can be prepared in many different ways such as boiled, fried, scrambled, and baked. Eggs are a versatile ingredient used in many dishes and baked goods.

data.system_prompt: Only provide a short, concise, brief and accurate response. Provide your response in a short summary paragraph. Only provide the response.
data.response: - They are solitary animals and should be housed alone, except for short periods when breeding. - There are 25 species, including popular pets like the Syrian (golden) hamster, dwarf hamster, and Roborovski hamster. - Hamsters are nocturnal and sleep during the day. They are active at dawn and dusk. - They eat a variety of foods including commercial hamster food, fruits, vegetables, nuts, seeds, and insects. - Hamsters have large cheek pouches they use to store and transport food. - Lifespan is typically 2-3 years, depending on species. - Hamsters are popular as pets because they are relatively easy to care for, enjoyable to observe, and interact well with humans.

data.system_prompt: Only provide a short, concise, brief and accurate response. Provide your response in a short summary paragraph. Only provide the response.
data.response: A mouse is a small rodent that has a long tail and pads on its feet. Mice are very common household pests. They have sharp teeth that allow them to chew through things, and they can squeeze through very small openings. Mice can spread diseases, contaminate food, and cause damage by gnawing on wires and other items. Common house mice typically have grayish-brown fur, while other species can vary in color. Mice are distinguished from rats by their much smaller size.

data.system_prompt: Only provide a short, concise, brief and accurate response. Provide your response in a short summary paragraph. Only provide the response.
data.response: A rat is a medium-sized rodent. Rats have long tails, pointed snouts, small ears, and sharp teeth. They typically have brown or gray fur. Rats are omnivores and eat a variety of foods including grains, fruits, vegetables, meat, and garbage. Rats live all over the world and are considered pests in many areas. They can spread disease and damage property by gnawing and burrowing. Rats are intelligent animals known for their ability to learn tricks and navigate mazes. The most common species of rat is the brown rat which originally lived in Asia but now has a worldwide distribution. Rats are successful at living in close proximity to humans and can be found in cities, farms, and homes.

data.system_prompt: Only provide a short, concise, brief and accurate response. Provide your response in a short summary paragraph. Only provide the response.
data.response: Rats live in a variety of habitats, but they are often found in areas with an abundance of food and shelter such as sewers,basements, attics, crawl spaces, cities, and agricultural areas. Their nests, called burrows, are dug underground or built at ground level using debris, vegetation, and rocks. Rats are very adaptable and can live anywhere they have access to food, water, and shelter.

data.system_prompt: Only provide a short, concise, brief and accurate response. Provide your response in a short summary paragraph. Only provide the response.
data.response: A chicken is a type of domesticated fowl. It is a gallinaceous bird that is raised for its meat and eggs. Chickens are members of the species Gallus gallus domesticus. They typically have feathers, wings, beaks, and two legs. Chickens make a "cluck" sound and the females are called hens while the males are called roosters. Domestic chickens are not able to fly high or far distances like their wild relatives. Chickens are omnivores and will eat seeds, insects and sometimes small animals. They live on farms and backyards around the world and are one of the most numerous domestic animals.

data.system_prompt: Only provide a short, concise, brief and accurate response. Provide your response in a short summary paragraph. Only provide the response.
data.response: - Adult female chickens are called hens. Male chickens are called roosters. - Hens start laying eggs at around 6 months old and can lay eggs nearly daily at their peak. The average hen lays about 250 eggs per year. - Hens make a clucking sound and roosters make a crowing sound. - Common hen breeds include Rhode Island Red, Leghorn, and Plymouth Rock. - Hens eat grains, insects, greens, and require calcium for egg production. - Hens live in groups called flocks. A group of chicks is called a brood. - Hens roost at night to sleep and lay eggs in nests. Mother hens fiercely protect their chicks. - Hens have a pecking order with a dominant lead hen. Hens peck to establish dominance. - Hens are descended from wild junglefowl and were domesticated over 8,000 years ago. - People raise hens for eggs and meat. Hens may also be kept as pets.

data.system_prompt: Only provide a short, concise, brief and accurate response. Provide your response in a short summary paragraph. Only provide the response.
data.response: Chicks are yellow because of carotenoid pigments deposited in the egg yolk by the mother hen. These pigments are fat-soluble compounds that are responsible for the yellow, orange, and red colors seen in many animal tissues. As the chick embryo develops, it absorbs the carotenoids into its tissue, which leads to the characteristic yellow color of newborn chicks. The yellow color helps camouflage the vulnerable chicks in their environment. After a few weeks, as chicks grow feathers, their color changes to white, brown, black etc. depending on the breed. So the bright yellow color is a temporary but important part of their early development.

data.system_prompt: Only provide a short, concise, brief and accurate response. Provide your response in a short summary paragraph. Only provide the response.
data.response: - Food source - Chickens are bred and raised as a major food source for humans, providing meat and eggs. Their domestication goes back thousands of years. - Farm animals - Chickens are often kept as farm animals, valued for meat and eggs but also helping control pests and produce manure. - Genetic research - As model organisms, chickens are important for genetic and developmental research. Their rapid breeding helps understand things like disease and birth defects. - Entertainment - Chickens are kept as pets and for entertainment purposes, such as chicken shows. Their behaviors and characteristics amuse some people. - Cultural significance - In some cultures, chickens hold symbolic meaning and value beyond just food, such as representing fertility or sacrifice. So in summary, chickens mainly exist today as a useful food source, farm animal, and genetic model that also holds some cultural significance and entertainment value for humans. Their domestication and breeding over millennia has shaped their role and existence.

data.system_prompt: Only provide a short, concise, brief and accurate response. Provide your response in a short summary paragraph. Only provide the response.
data.response: Sea whales are marine mammals that live in the oceans around the world. They are some of the largest animals on Earth, including blue whales, humpback whales, and sperm whales. Whales are mammals that breathe air, give birth to live young, and produce milk to feed their offspring. They have streamlined bodies to help them swim through the water. Most whales migrate long distances each year between feeding grounds and breeding grounds. Whales face a number of threats from human activities like whaling, ship strikes, fishing gear entanglement, and ocean noise pollution. Many whale species are endangered and conservation efforts aim to protect their populations.

Due to restrictions on the ivory trade and declining populations of these animals, ivory has become increasingly rare and expensive over time. Today, ivory is viewed as a luxury material used in things like jewelry, ornaments, art, and piano keys. Both the difficulty of obtaining ivory and the demand for it contribute to its high prices.

f43c10e56d32a87cea57745177349671da3f4ba8.system_prompt: Only provide a short, concise, brief and accurate response. Provide your response in a short summary paragraph. Only provide the response.
f43c10e56d32a87cea57745177349671da3f4ba8.response: Ivory is a hard, smooth material derived from the tusks and teeth of animals, most notably elephants. For centuries it was used to make items like jewelry, piano keys, and ornamental objects. Ivory was highly prized and traded extensively, which led to the decimation of elephant populations. The ivory trade is now banned internationally to protect endangered elephants. Synthetic ivories have been developed as an alternative.

1bf533e1b4e21cb501fc149d8ea6f574568796ab.query: What kind of food do lions eat?
1bf533e1b4e21cb501fc149d8ea6f574568796ab.user_prompt: What kind of food do lions eat?
1bf533e1b4e21cb501fc149d8ea6f574568796ab.system_prompt: Only provide a short, concise, brief and accurate response. Provide your response in a short summary paragraph. Only provide the response.
1bf533e1b4e21cb501fc149d8ea6f574568796ab.response: Lions are carnivores and eat primarily meat. Their prey includes antelopes, zebras, wildebeests, buffaloes, and other large animals. Lions hunt and kill these animals using their claws and powerful jaws. They usually eat the flesh and organs of their prey, and sometimes bones as well. As carnivores, meat makes up the vast majority of a lion's diet.

634d82f8581b63eb69b58ce4c77ae7b09a56a105.query: What kinds of food do humans eat?
634d82f8581b63eb69b58ce4c77ae7b09a56a105.user_prompt: What kinds of food do humans eat?
634d82f8581b63eb69b58ce4c77ae7b09a56a105.system_prompt: Only provide a short, concise, brief and accurate response. Provide your response in a short summary paragraph. Only provide the response.
634d82f8581b63eb69b58ce4c77ae7b09a56a105.response: Humans eat a wide variety of foods. Some common categories of foods eaten by humans include fruits, vegetables, grains, proteins (meat, dairy, eggs, legumes), and fats/oils. The specific foods consumed depend on factors like geography, culture, preferences, health status, and access. Overall, humans are omnivores and can obtain nutrients from both plant and animal sources.

3b033319ef673f60c17c1e110d2b192f9a1dcec0.query: Are fish a good source of food?
3b033319ef673f60c17c1e110d2b192f9a1dcec0.user_prompt: Are fish a good source of food?
3b033319ef673f60c17c1e110d2b192f9a1dcec0.system_prompt: Only provide a short, concise, brief and accurate response. Provide your response in a short summary paragraph. Only provide the response.
3b033319ef673f60c17c1e110d2b192f9a1dcec0.response: Fish can be a nutritious part of a balanced diet. Fish provide high-quality protein, omega-3 fatty acids, vitamins, and minerals. However, some fish may contain contaminants like mercury, so moderation and choosing low-mercury fish are recommended. Overall, fish can be a healthy food choice as part of a varied diet.

dfcc151fa547b125acd7070a26f88366123b727d.query: Tell me a bit how chickens evolved.
dfcc151fa547b125acd7070a26f88366123b727d.user_prompt: Tell me a bit how chickens evolved.
dfcc151fa547b125acd7070a26f88366123b727d.system_prompt: Only provide a short, concise, brief and accurate response. Provide your response in a short summary paragraph. Only provide the response.
dfcc151fa547b125acd7070a26f88366123b727d.response: The domestic chicken evolved from the red junglefowl, a bird native to Southeast Asia. It is believed that junglefowl were first domesticated around 8,000 years ago in Asia. Through selective breeding over thousands of years, humans shaped the junglefowl into the familiar domestic chickens we know today. Some key evolutionary changes include a reduction in aggressive behavior, increased egg-laying, and adaptations for meat production like increased body size. The dozens of chicken breeds we have now are the result of isolating and selecting for particular traits over generations. In summary, chickens evolved from red junglefowl through artificial selection by humans over several millennia for traits desirable for food production.

d83be106dce2bafdf40e305ec36cbc481fb176fc.system_prompt: Only provide a short, concise, brief and accurate response. Provide your response in a short summary paragraph. Only provide the response.
d83be106dce2bafdf40e305ec36cbc481fb176fc.response: The chicken-and-egg causality dilemma refers to the question of which came first - chickens or chicken eggs. This dilemma stems from the observation that all chickens hatch from eggs, and all chicken eggs are laid by chickens. - Evolutionary ancestors of chickens laid eggs that then mutated and hatched into chickens. So the egg came first. - Proto-chickens that were almost chickens, but not quite, laid eggs containing the first true chickens. So the egg came first. - The first chicken was genetically distinct from its parents and thus came about through some other evolutionary process, not being hatched from an egg. So the chicken came first. Ultimately there is no definitive scientific answer, since no one can point to the first chicken or egg fossil. The dilemma highlights the complex causal relationships in evolution. But most experts think the egg likely came first, laid by a proto-chicken ancestor.

fd7dd720acdce592ea41c21314713c1113ef6bfa.system_prompt: Only provide a short, concise, brief and accurate response. Provide your response in a short summary paragraph. Only provide the response.
fd7dd720acdce592ea41c21314713c1113ef6bfa.response: Eggs are oval or round reproductive cells produced by female animals. They contain all the nutrients and genetic material needed for an embryo to develop. The hard outer shell protects the developing embryo and allows gas exchange. The most commonly eaten eggs come from chickens, ducks, quail, and fish. Eggs are an excellent source of protein and nutrients. They can be prepared in many different ways such as boiled, fried, scrambled, and baked. Eggs are a versatile ingredient used in many dishes and baked goods.

fb662a8cf9c2ffeb7ea3610aa31d5eb4ce881d2c.system_prompt: Only provide a short, concise, brief and accurate response. Provide your response in a short summary paragraph. Only provide the response.
fb662a8cf9c2ffeb7ea3610aa31d5eb4ce881d2c.response: - They are solitary animals and should be housed alone, except for short periods when breeding. - There are 25 species, including popular pets like the Syrian (golden) hamster, dwarf hamster, and Roborovski hamster. - Hamsters are nocturnal and sleep during the day. They are active at dawn and dusk. - They eat a variety of foods including commercial hamster food, fruits, vegetables, nuts, seeds, and insects. - Hamsters have large cheek pouches they use to store and transport food. - Lifespan is typically 2-3 years, depending on species. - Hamsters are popular as pets because they are relatively easy to care for, enjoyable to observe, and interact well with humans.

8c193ae125aaf877f64bed9fd1c43307900760e1.system_prompt: Only provide a short, concise, brief and accurate response. Provide your response in a short summary paragraph. Only provide the response.
8c193ae125aaf877f64bed9fd1c43307900760e1.response: A mouse is a small rodent that has a long tail and pads on its feet. Mice are very common household pests. They have sharp teeth that allow them to chew through things, and they can squeeze through very small openings. Mice can spread diseases, contaminate food, and cause damage by gnawing on wires and other items. Common house mice typically have grayish-brown fur, while other species can vary in color. Mice are distinguished from rats by their much smaller size.

e27feb66eeb702608ec17d4a95302d33525469ae.system_prompt: Only provide a short, concise, brief and accurate response. Provide your response in a short summary paragraph. Only provide the response.
e27feb66eeb702608ec17d4a95302d33525469ae.response: A rat is a medium-sized rodent. Rats have long tails, pointed snouts, small ears, and sharp teeth. They typically have brown or gray fur. Rats are omnivores and eat a variety of foods including grains, fruits, vegetables, meat, and garbage. Rats live all over the world and are considered pests in many areas. They can spread disease and damage property by gnawing and burrowing. Rats are intelligent animals known for their ability to learn tricks and navigate mazes. The most common species of rat is the brown rat which originally lived in Asia but now has a worldwide distribution. Rats are successful at living in close proximity to humans and can be found in cities, farms, and homes.

e2f5d14d01e1171dc1c78b4bc0ea1e088d7f5f03.system_prompt: Only provide a short, concise, brief and accurate response. Provide your response in a short summary paragraph. Only provide the response.
e2f5d14d01e1171dc1c78b4bc0ea1e088d7f5f03.response: Rats live in a variety of habitats, but they are often found in areas with an abundance of food and shelter such as sewers,basements, attics, crawl spaces, cities, and agricultural areas. Their nests, called burrows, are dug underground or built at ground level using debris, vegetation, and rocks. Rats are very adaptable and can live anywhere they have access to food, water, and shelter.

71e20f13d0745816e3b5ac4bcf1f74ab7b878b83.system_prompt: Only provide a short, concise, brief and accurate response. Provide your response in a short summary paragraph. Only provide the response.
71e20f13d0745816e3b5ac4bcf1f74ab7b878b83.response: A chicken is a type of domesticated fowl. It is a gallinaceous bird that is raised for its meat and eggs. Chickens are members of the species Gallus gallus domesticus. They typically have feathers, wings, beaks, and two legs. Chickens make a "cluck" sound and the females are called hens while the males are called roosters. Domestic chickens are not able to fly high or far distances like their wild relatives. Chickens are omnivores and will eat seeds, insects and sometimes small animals. They live on farms and backyards around the world and are one of the most numerous domestic animals.

24d017729bdda83d1d5d1f149b789e8cb74c9b25.system_prompt: Only provide a short, concise, brief and accurate response. Provide your response in a short summary paragraph. Only provide the response.
24d017729bdda83d1d5d1f149b789e8cb74c9b25.response: - Adult female chickens are called hens. Male chickens are called roosters. - Hens start laying eggs at around 6 months old and can lay eggs nearly daily at their peak. The average hen lays about 250 eggs per year. - Hens make a clucking sound and roosters make a crowing sound. - Common hen breeds include Rhode Island Red, Leghorn, and Plymouth Rock. - Hens eat grains, insects, greens, and require calcium for egg production. - Hens live in groups called flocks. A group of chicks is called a brood. - Hens roost at night to sleep and lay eggs in nests. Mother hens fiercely protect their chicks. - Hens have a pecking order with a dominant lead hen. Hens peck to establish dominance. - Hens are descended from wild junglefowl and were domesticated over 8,000 years ago. - People raise hens for eggs and meat. Hens may also be kept as pets.

deb622c127235e1128ab35b029f5654d6c7f9bee.system_prompt: Only provide a short, concise, brief and accurate response. Provide your response in a short summary paragraph. Only provide the response.
deb622c127235e1128ab35b029f5654d6c7f9bee.response: Chicks are yellow because of carotenoid pigments deposited in the egg yolk by the mother hen. These pigments are fat-soluble compounds that are responsible for the yellow, orange, and red colors seen in many animal tissues. As the chick embryo develops, it absorbs the carotenoids into its tissue, which leads to the characteristic yellow color of newborn chicks. The yellow color helps camouflage the vulnerable chicks in their environment. After a few weeks, as chicks grow feathers, their color changes to white, brown, black etc. depending on the breed. So the bright yellow color is a temporary but important part of their early development.

a67519cb7eb40802730ea30968a701c2212b5c84.system_prompt: Only provide a short, concise, brief and accurate response. Provide your response in a short summary paragraph. Only provide the response.
a67519cb7eb40802730ea30968a701c2212b5c84.response: - Food source - Chickens are bred and raised as a major food source for humans, providing meat and eggs. Their domestication goes back thousands of years. - Farm animals - Chickens are often kept as farm animals, valued for meat and eggs but also helping control pests and produce manure. - Genetic research - As model organisms, chickens are important for genetic and developmental research. Their rapid breeding helps understand things like disease and birth defects. - Entertainment - Chickens are kept as pets and for entertainment purposes, such as chicken shows. Their behaviors and characteristics amuse some people. - Cultural significance - In some cultures, chickens hold symbolic meaning and value beyond just food, such as representing fertility or sacrifice. So in summary, chickens mainly exist today as a useful food source, farm animal, and genetic model that also holds some cultural significance and entertainment value for humans. Their domestication and breeding over millennia has shaped their role and existence.

f0beff72e6e9d70cb26fb91851e7e3e7a3353144.system_prompt: Only provide a short, concise, brief and accurate response. Provide your response in a short summary paragraph. Only provide the response.
f0beff72e6e9d70cb26fb91851e7e3e7a3353144.response: Sea whales are marine mammals that live in the oceans around the world. They are some of the largest animals on Earth, including blue whales, humpback whales, and sperm whales. Whales are mammals that breathe air, give birth to live young, and produce milk to feed their offspring. They have streamlined bodies to help them swim through the water. Most whales migrate long distances each year between feeding grounds and breeding grounds. Whales face a number of threats from human activities like whaling, ship strikes, fishing gear entanglement, and ocean noise pollution. Many whale species are endangered and conservation efforts aim to protect their populations.
